author: 0xgradientdescent
content: Hi everyone, I'm trying to learn more about crypto and is reading the "token economy" book. In one of the chapter, the author said that in the case of bitcoin, since people are mining in pools instead of mining alone, it can be regarded as "delegated" PoW instead of PoW. Thinking about PoS, would the fact that people staking in "pool" through services like Coinbase and Lido make it "delegated" PoS? If so, how is it different from DPoS imolemented in cardano and polkadot?

author: pietjepuk
content: Staking (less than 32 ETH) with Coinbase/Lido means they can just take your money and run (or disappear). The old "not your keys, not your coins" thing. Doesn't really matter whether the staking protocol is DPoS or PoS.

author: 0xgradientdescent
content: what about rocketpool? my question essentially is that: if mining pool increases centralization and makes pow becomes delegated pow, does staking pool increase centralization?
